info.description: API spec for Setu AA gateway
info.title: AA Gateway

tags.name: AA participants APIs
tags.description: APIs to fetch Account Aggregator ecosystem participants data i.e FIPs, FIUs or AAs

tags.name: Notification APIs
tags.description: APIs to receive notifications from AA

get.description: This API is used to get the list of FIPs.

parameters.name: x-vault-config
parameters.description: Path to fetch config from Vault

post.description:
This API is intended for AA Client to request generation of digitally signed consent artefacts. The customer has to use the AA application to select accounts and approve consent generation. Once the customer approves the consent request on the AA application, AA generates the digitally signed consent artefacts. Note - The AA Client never sees the account of the customer or directly participates in consent generation.

Note: “Request Body Example Value” and “Responses Example Value” given below is for illustrative purposes only.

parameters.name: x-vault-config
parameters.description: Path to fetch config from Vault

get.description: This API gets consent information using request ID.

parameters.name: x-vault-config
parameters.description: Path to fetch config from Vault

post.description: This API revokes a consent based on request ID.

parameters.description: Path to fetch config from Vault

post.description: This API is used to initiate a data fetch for FI data.

parameters.description: Path to fetch config from Vault

parameters.name: aa_api_key
parameters.description: API key used to verify AA's identity

post.description: This endpoint is used by AA to send Consent Status notifications.

parameters.name: aa_api_key
parameters.description: API key used to verify AA's identity

post.description: This endpoint is used by AA to send FI data notifications.

This API is intended for AA Client to request generation of digitally signed consent artefacts. The customer has to use the AA application to select accounts and approve consent generation. Once the customer approves the consent request on the AA application, AA generates the digitally signed consent artefacts. Note - The AA Client never sees the account of the customer or directly participates in consent generation.

Note: “Request Body Example Value” and “Responses Example Value” given below is for illustrative purposes only.

get.description: This API gets consent information using request ID.

post.description: This API revokes a consent based on request ID.

get.description: This API gets the last data fetch status for a consent

post.description: This API is used to initiate a data fetch for FI data.

get.description: This API gets consent information using request ID.

id.description: Request identifier to fetch the status and data.

dataRange.description: Time range for which the data is being requested

status.description: Status for this data fetch session

consentId.description: Consent identifier for this data fetch request.

fips.description: Array of accounts for a particular fip

to.description: Selects the ending date-time from where the financial information is to be end. It is a mandatory field only if consentTypes includes ENUM TRANSACTIONS in consent parameters.

from.description: Selects the starting date-time from where the financial information is to be start. It is a mandatory field only if consentTypes includes ENUM TRANSACTIONS in consent parameters.

txnid.description: Trnsaction id of the request. Must be same value as sent in the request

errorMsg.description: Error message with additional details. Ensure no sensitive information is included in the error message.

errorCode.description: Error code indicating the problem with the request

dataRange.description: Time range for which the data is being requested (should be inclusive of the consent's FIDataRange)

consentId.description: The request identifier to fetch the status and data.

id.description: The request identifier to fetch the status and data.

url.description: The URL link to the consent manager app for user to complete the flow.

redirectUrl.description: URL to redirect to after completion of consent journey

items.description: Specify extra data in key-value pair that might be required for custom arguments or filteration

usage.description: Usage object for this consent. Defines how many times and when this consent has been used for data fetch

accountsLinked.description: List of accounts which the consent would fetch FI from. For a consent between FIU & AA, this list could have accounts from multiple FIP. For a consent between FIP & AA, only accounts from particular FIP must be present in this section.

linkRefNumber.description: FIP's linkRefNumber as shared by the FIP after linking

count.description: Count of the number of times data has been fetched for this consent

lastUsed.description: Timestamp of last data fetch for this consent

fetchType.description: FI Fetch type. Could be ONETIME or PERIODIC

consentMode.description: Consent Mode as defined in the AA Technical Specification

purpose.description: Purpose of the consent defined in the AA Technical Specification

frequency.description: Defines frequency of FI data fetch within the defined time unit. E.g.HOURLY,DAILY,MONTHLY,YEARLY.The maximum frequency value that can be defined is 1 request per HOUR. Similaraly it will be 24 requests per DAY and so on. Frequency can not be set below 1 request per hour.

dataRange.description: Data Range (Datetime) for the Financial Information Requested

dataFilter.description: rules that will be utilized by FIP to filter the data

dataLife.description: Datalife defines for how long can the FIU/AA Application store the data

consentStart.description: Start date-time of the consent. This field would allow for Post-Dated consent.

unit.description: A unit of how long consumer can store the data

value.description: Define the value of unit of how long can consumer store the data

type.description: The condition to filter the data on.

unit.description: Defines the time unit of the frequency to access the financial information.

value.description: Define the number of times FI data can be fetched within the defined time unit.

code.description: Purpose Code as defined in the AA Technical Specification

refUri.description: URL where the purpose is further defined

type.description: Category name of the Purpose code

purpose.description: Purpose of the consent defined in the AA Technical Specification

consentMode.description: Consent Mode as defined in the AA Technical Specification

frequency.description: Defines frequency of FI data fetch within the defined time unit. E.g.HOURLY,DAILY,MONTHLY,YEARLY.The maximum frequency value that can be defined is 1 request per HOUR. Similaraly it will be 24 requests per DAY and so on. Frequency can not be set below 1 request per hour.

consentDuration.description: How long consumer is allowed to store data

dataFilter.description: rules that will be utilized by FIP to filter the data

Usage.description: Usage object for this consent. Defines how many times and when this consent has been used for data fetch

count.description: Count of the number of times data has been fetched for this consent

lastUsed.description: Timestamp of last data fetch for this consent

fetchType.description: FI Fetch type. Could be ONETIME or PERIODIC

consentMode.description: Consent Mode as defined in the AA Technical Specification

Purpose.description: Purpose of the consent defined in the AA Technical Specification

DataProvider.description: DataProvider ID. For a consent between FIP & AA, DataProvider would be FIP whereas for a consent between FIU/AA Application & AA, DataProvider would be AA.

Accounts.description: List of accounts which the consent would fetch FI from. For a consent between FIU & AA, this list could have accounts from multiple FIP. For a consent between FIP & AA, only accounts from particular FIP must be present in this section.

FIDataRange.description: Data Range (Datetime) for the Financial Information Requested

DataLife.description: Datalife defines for how long can the FIU/AA Application store the data

Frequency.description: Defines frequency of FI data fetch within the defined time unit. E.g.HOURLY,DAILY,MONTHLY,YEARLY.The maximum frequency value that can be defined is 1 request per HOUR. Similaraly it will be 24 requests per DAY and so on. Frequency can not be set below 1 request per hour.

DataFilter.description: rules that will be utilized by FIP to filter the data

consentStart.description: Start date-time of the consent. This field would allow for Post-Dated consent.

DataConsumer.description: Dataconsumer ID. For a consent between FIP & AA, Dataconsumer would be AA whereas for a consent between FIU/AA Application & AA, Dataconsumer would be FIU/AA Application.

type.description: The condition to filter the data on.

unit.description: Defines the time unit of the frequency to access the financial information.

value.description: Define the number of times FI data can be fetched within the defined time unit.

unit.description: A unit of how long consumer can store the data.

value.description: Value for the Datalife Unit. If INF, value must be set to 0.

linkRefNumber.description: FIP's linkRefNumber as shared by the FIP after linking

type.description: Category name of the Purpose code

Detail.description: Specify the financial information types that customer wants to access

FIDataRange.description: Specify the datetime range for querying the financial information

DataLife.description: How long consumer is allowed to store data

Frequency.description: Defines frequency of FI data fetch within the defined time unit. E.g.HOURLY,DAILY,MONTHLY,YEARLY.The maximum frequency value that can be defined is 1 request per HOUR. Similaraly it will be 24 requests per DAY and so on. Frequency can not be set below 1 request per hour.

DataFilter.description: rules that will be utilized by FIP to filter the data

consentStart.description: Start date-time of the consent. This field would allow for Post-Dated consent.
